reviewText:
A lot of bugs and mindless shooting, this almost gamebreakingly buggy game is something you should stay well away from.

After playing only several games, I have seen some stupid stuff, from wall hacks to people being invulnerable and passing through the ground, still being able to kill you.

The graphics are also gritty and blurry making it hard to even aim at people, making weapons other than melee and sniper complete useless as is seen in most high leveled lobbys.
Most people will be spamming either melee weapons and combos that stun you (permastuns are simply broken) or 1 shot you with overpowered snipers.

The combat is also bland and requires no skill, just the ability to spam left click.

No pay to win, but that does not matter when you all you have to do is google search how to hack the game, and bam: Insta win games all day.

The gameplay itself is all based on luck, if someone melees you and lands a stun, its game over bro, game over.
Practically no player base, having around 100-200 people searching for online matches at a time makes it hard to find games.

Personal Rating: 1.5/5

reviewText:
An attempted rehash gone wrong.

A lot of original features have been removed; and the gameplay has definitely changed.

Quest mode isn't satisfying anymore, you have to purchase lives with real world money (1 life is around 2.50 cents).

Haven't tried the PVP aspect of the game, but I didn't have any intention to after seeing the quest mode.

If you wanna play GunZ, find a private server of the old one.

Comparing the two, the first one is byfar more fun and original.

reviewText: Although this game is considered the sucessor to GunZ the Duel, these two games, after playing around a bit, are almost nothing alike. GunZ 2 has taken out pretty much everything which made GunZ the game it was. Although it is advertised as a fast paced action game, it might as well be another third person shooter with some wall running and dashes. The dashing is stiff and the delay after each dash makes it feel like you might as well walk unless you want to risk getting comboed right after you dash. Overall, this game is something I would not reccomend if you have come from GunZ the Duel as it is sucessor in name only.\n\nTLDR: If you liked GunZ for what it was, this is not the game for you, the gameplay is very different.

reviewText:
Horrible. This game has some of the worst controls and gameplay mechanics I have ever seen. They promise fast paced, high-mobility action. However, they deliver boring, clunky, hard-to-learn controls, and stun-locked gameplay. The weapons are extremely unbalanced, some weapons killing you in one hit, or taking you from full health to none in a matter of seconds. Swords, which are one of the basic, and suposedly more fun elements of the game are either useless, or overpowered. One hit from a sword stunlocks you into oblivion, where you might as well take your hands off the keyboard and wait for your inevitable death. Or, swords are useless, trying to run up on an enemy with any kind of machinegun is pointless, because you will be annihilated.

The controls are the worst part of this game. Double tap this, double tap that, but don't double tap spacebar while running up a while, you'll jump off. Oh, but to get on the wall, press spacebar after jumping towards it, which is activated by spacebar. To dash you have to double tap the movement keys, but the dashing is unlimited so there is no disadvantage to double tapping all the time.

I may have only played a little bit of the game, about an hour, because I honestly couldn't stand it. The matchmaking is unbalanced, placing level one characters against level twenties. The community is toxic, constantly using offensive remarks: fggt"

reviewText: Horrible for a 2014 game. Clunky control and bad hit detection, feels like it was made for 2005. Glitches that let you fall through the map and die without much effort. Co-op campaign's netcode is awful. Even if you have a pretty low ping to host the enemies will teleport or appear alive after dying, etc.. During that time their animations appear jittery too. Temporary weapons from the game store which can also be repaired or upgraded to give you a huge advantage over those using default weapons, which can't be upgraded. I haven't seen it for myself, but I saw many hack complaints. Pay2Win is very real here as well. Multiplayer is a mess, and the co-op campaign is not good. Sniper(Ivan) is a significantly inferior class/character to get stuck with when people move around like monkies on crack in multiplayer.

reviewText: I've been a fan of the Gunz series for quite some time, even with all the ups and downs the original Gunz had gone through. Really the only thing that drove me away from the first was the invasion of hackers, either wise I'd probably would've been playing it until this finally launched.\nLet me make something clear that this game definitely has taken another route than the original Gunz template laid out. Mainly the whole style" attributes are gone but I do believe this helped open the game up to many more players as well as bring a lot more importance onto every aspect the game has to offer
date: instead of just a small segment. The customization
recommended: while not currently as diverse as I'd like
hoursPlayed: has the potential for a lot of growth. Currently there are 4 classes and most of them boast weapons unique to their class. The only similarity currently is Ivan (Silent Avenger) and Rena (Shadow Dancer) sharing the same automatic weapon type (an SMG). However they all have a firearm that is unique to them as well as a melee weapon that is unique to them as well that have quite the diverse abilities for them. Rena for instance wields two short sword nodachis (the game calls them daggers for some reason) and as a result she has the longest combo both on ground and air. She is also
voteText: I believe
helpfulPercent: the fastest character in the bunch; though all of them are pretty quick. While on the other hand you have Max
votesHelpful: who wields a giant melee shield into battle. This shield may be a bit slow and boasting a low combo count
votesTotal: but it certainly hurts to get hit with. Not to mention he has the only block that completely protects against most firearms. His trade off is being one of the slowest classes and also having a pretty short reach with his firearms
votesFunny: though you can get some lucky shots with the minigun.\n\nBut I do like that each character is now unique. In the original Gunz
commentsCount: there were several classes to choose from but I never really noticed any difference between them besides what weapons they started off with (which could all be changed to whatever you wanted later on). Now I mentioned customization is a bit lax atm as all the classes are pretty much restricted to their own weaponry currently. I don't know if they plan to allow mixing up weapons later on or keeping them restricted to help make the classes stand out
column16: we'll just have to see where it goes.\n\nNow the only major drawback to this game so far has been on the server side of things. Unfortunately it is quite a bit difficult getting into the game (with the low server capacity cap
column17: currently only 4500). However another server side issue is the downside to peer to peer network. Unfortunately lag plays a huge factor when it comes to fast paced games and even with a strong connection
column18: you can end up with a nasty lag situation all depending on who the host is. There aren't really any official servers people play on but more so user hosted matches. This ultimately can lead to many instances where some players can connect just fine but others have horrible connections or spike all over the place
column19: simply because of the distance to the current host. Now the host can be changed via an option to help mitigate this issue
column20: but unfortunately you're still at the mercy of whoever is in the room. While someone's own internet may be pretty good
column21: that doesn't necessarily make them ideal hosts. Not to mention that the more people trying to connect to one game
column22: the worse a lag situation can get. I discovered this issue playing Tenchu Z on the Xbox 360. The multiplayer lag in that game increases expotentially depending on how many participants are in the group (max 4 players). At 4 players
column23: the game is essentially unplayable for anyone but the host. However when you remove that 4th person
column24: at 3 players the game is a lot more stable. Likewise dropping it down to 2 people
column25: depending on who is hosting
column26: there may be little to no lag at all. But it never mattered who was hosting or how good their connection was
column27: the second a 4th player was involved
column28: the match would always lag horribly.\n\nNow the devs for Gunz 2 are working on increasing the server capacity and trying to improve their network to help make the experience much more stable for everyone but that stuff takes time. However
column29: that is why the game is in an early-access stage (something many players tend to forget). There are many improvements to be made and stuff to add to the game to make it an amazing experience. However
column30: Gunz 2 certainly can be an amazing title as long as it could pull its act together and remain strong
column31: especially for a free-to-play title. Which by the way
column32: they took a bit note from the original Gunz in how to handle the free-to-play market. There was a big divide between players who bought their gear in game and players who purchased better gear using actual currency
column33: essentially creating a pay-to-win model. Though Gunz 2 handles this well by only having cosmetic things attached to the real currency
column34: while every gear piece can be purchased with in game currency. Definitely an improvement and something that lets many new players come enjoy the game without feeling at a disadvantage because they don't want to make a real money investment to a game they may or may not spend a lot of time with. Now people who want to put a little cash into their characters can help make themselves stand out and feel unique
column35: without gaining an unfair advantage over other players."

reviewText:
GunZ 2: The Second Duel is much more stable when its down to game play than GunZ 1, if you were one of the guys/girls that discovered IJJI.COM before it came to end. This is a game for you! GunZ 2 resembles a fast-action-packed shoot em up & ninja fighting genre all at once! And surprisingly all the character's are very balanced! Despite certain opinions of other players each character has a fair advantage or disadvantage about them and with 6 unique character's that has their own creative abilities it gives you a good set of game time to play them all and figure out what is your favourite! Most of my hours on this game was based on playing just one character so think of how long my hours would be if I played all six! Also to put it out there, with lots of different maps, weapons, costumes & even a type of case pack opening scenario all for free this game has left me very impressed! Despite having a few items that you can pay for with real money I don't find this a concern as they have a play more to earn more system with every item being available to buy with in game currency.

My only flaw with this game (unfortunately) is the following:

Lack of players on the server, making searching for games in ranked a pain.
Connection issue: Despite having indiviual servers for EU & NA & SK we still have lag from players in NA or SK on a EU server which makes it unfair for all the EU players in the lobby as the NA or SK player always get host advantage.
No trading/timer weapons - I know i mentioned previous a case opening scenario but once you get the item it's either on a timer or untradeable to other steam accounts... (but the game is free so it makes sense)

Apart from that GunZ 2: The Second is most definitely a worthy game to give a try (LETS NOT FORGET THIS IS A FREE GAME)

reviewText:
This game is good, has its flaws, probably wont be upgraded, but still pretty damn good.
For begginers, u should ask some1, to teach you how to play, its not so hard, but without the basic tricks, u'll get bored and quit.
For those, whose region is always on zero people, try a proxy with some country thats close to you, and more populated, or ask some people from there, to party with you, they can invite you to games in their regions.
I saw some comments saying, this game's playstyle is boring and monotonous... it only depends on the player, how they play, you can explore many styles, i played around 200 hours (eu gunz + steam), and i'm only decent with elena ivan and wayne, still 2 chars left to get some skills, and you can always get better, as i said, depends on u.
Yes, there are a few hackers, seen 1 in the last 2 weeks (EU player here), but you can make those hackers leave, just remember their name, say it in channel, and DODGE every game they are in. Believe me, they'll quit (and no1 will make 10 steam accounts, or pay 10$ just to ♥♥♥ with u once, also u can surrender games)


To sum it up.. i recommend this game, because its awesome, and one of the most competitive ones i have played with :) (yes yes, gunz1 is better, but no player base and full of hackers on private servers... so play this game, make the developers change their mind :))
